channel.title: A bunch of questions that I need answering. *Shrugs* You might know one or two
channel.description:
Alright...Here they are. :)
1) Shops. [s]How do you edit what they have in them, add what they have, [/s]and change the prices of the items?
[s]2) Monsters. How do you spawn 'em? (Put them somewhere)[/s]
3) I was wondering how to place a portal. (That teles you of course, somewhere.)
4) Oooh, since i'm making this post, I might as well tell you the error i'm getting. When I run my server, I get this: [code]config\objects.cfg: file not found.[/code] I know this is stupid probably, but how do I fix it? o_O Ugh..now i'm getting 2 more errors, i've been messing around with stuff too much. [code]client.java:10501: illegal character: \92[/code] [code]client.java:10635: 'else' without 'if' else if <command.startsWith<"runes">>[/code] 5) How do I stop my spawns from dissapearing every few minutes? (I want them to just be there, untill someone picks them up, THEN they respawn.)
6) How do you make an NPC automatically attack you when you get near it?
[s]7) How do you make a command that teles you somewhere? If you could just give me the code for these 2 commands that'd be great-
::BC Would take you to 3038,3654 ::MC Would take you to 3020,3532[/s]
The source I have is one a friend made, but it's based of CheezScape.
Thanks in advanced guys.

item.title: A bunch of questions that I need answering. *Shrugs* You might know one or two
item.dc:creator: @Miss_Doctor Miss_Doctor
item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

And I put this in what file? client.java?
And in what part of the file…Sighs

I wish you guys would be a little more specific[br][size=1]Posted on: June 23, 2007, 03:31:38 PM[/size][hr]YES! I just looked through my client.java files and found examples of some of the commands that were already there. I just copied and pasted, then edited it. WOOT! Thanks anyway though…(Even though it didnt work o_O) Now, just a few questions left.[br][size=1]Posted on: June 23, 2007, 03:58:38 PM[/size][hr]A big huge BUMP!

[br][size=1]Posted on: June 23, 2007, 05:07:51 PM[/size][hr]…Omg, someone please reply

Read full topic
item.source: A bunch of questions that I need answering. *Shrugs* You might know one or two

item.title: A bunch of questions that I need answering. *Shrugs* You might know one or two
item.dc:creator: @Shift Shift
item.description:
@Shift wrote:

  1. How do I stop my spawns from dissapearing every few minutes? (I want them to just be there, untill someone picks them up, THEN they respawn.)
    Try messing around in ItemHandler, I think that’s where it is.

  2. How do you make an NPC automatically attack you when you get near it?
    There isn’t a real great base for this out yet, it has been done but its not very good.

  3. [i]How do you make a command that teles you somewhere? If you could just give me the code for these 2 commands that’d be great-

::BC Would take you to 3038,3654
::MC Would take you to 3020,3532[/i]

if(command.equals("BC")){
teleportToX = 3038;
teleportToY = 3654
}
if(command.equals("MC")){
teleportToX = 3020;
teleportToY = 3532;
}

Read full topic

item.title: A bunch of questions that I need answering. *Shrugs* You might know one or two
item.dc:creator: @Miss_Doctor Miss_Doctor
item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

[quote=“ownage plz, post:14, topic:115282”][code]for the item price … in client search for this method

public double GetItemShopValue

scroll down a bit you should see

TotPrice = (ShopValue * 1.26875);

delete the * 1.26875 parts[/code][/quote]
Ok, I followed what you said…But instead of seeing that, I got this:

TotPrice = (ShopValue * 1); //Calculates price for 1 item, in db is stored for 0 items (strange but true)

Um…If it’s like this, why are all those long numbers still there ? Do I delete 1? :S[br][size=1]Posted on: June 23, 2007, 12:04:38 PM[/size][hr]I’m sorry, but I need to BUMP this thread…no one is replying I need help.

Read full topic

delete the * 1.26875 parts[/code]

item.title: A bunch of questions that I need answering. *Shrugs* You might know one or two
item.dc:creator: @Miss_Doctor Miss_Doctor
item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

You have to divide what you want the price to be by like 1.2685 or so I.E:

Want whip be 1mill. Take 1,000,000 / 1.2685 = decimels, replace second number of the noted and unoted item, play around with the 1.2685 till you get it accurate.


oookay too many people at once, and legend…if I have to do all that just to edit a number price, I rather not.[br][size=1]Posted on: June 22, 2007, 08:02:24 PM[/size][hr]I g2g, i’ll be back on tomorrow.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

No it is item.cfg, and th 2 # of the item

Huh ? Ok no it’s Item.cfg…alright, I opened that up…what part of that is the price? :S

Well…atleast I know how to edit the examine tag now…right? (That is the examine tag, right? Lol.)

Thanks um…anyway…if you could come back though to explain yourself more clearly? o_O

(#2 of what?)

item.title: A bunch of questions that I need answering. *Shrugs* You might know one or two
item.dc:creator: @Shift Shift
item.description:
@Shift wrote:

  1. Already been solved.
spawn = ID    X    Y   HEIGHT   MINX   MINY   MAXX MAXY WALKTYPE DESCRIPTION
  1. There are so many tutorials on object spawning, I’d rather not explain it.
  2. Go in the config folder and make a new file named objects.cfg

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Miss_Doctor Miss_Doctor
item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

Ok…When I tried to add a monster through that last time, it messed up my server…I could try again though, see what happens. And how do I get the addglobalobj method?

Wait…do you mean I need that…thing to spawn monsters? :S And how do I get it?

And the shops…its just so confusing, I mean, I can’t tell the item numbers from the amounts! Ugh!

(And some arent even in the item lists!)
…Update:

YESS! Okay, yay! I know how to add items to the shop, and edit what’s there…But I don’t know how to edit the prices…i don’t think it’s under shops.cfg.
[br][size=1]Posted on: June 22, 2007, 07:10:01 PM[/size][hr]Umm…Bump? Kinda suprised no ones replying…
